page.title: 11Tiddenfoot Pit
page.content: Tiddenfoot Pit is an old sand quarry which has been filled with water. All around it are very high, beautiful banks covered in grass. There are lots of trees on one side, most of them are willows. On the opposite side there is a line of poplar trees. Behind these is the Grand Union Canal. Often there are swans and ducks on the water. Fishermen from the local Anglers' Club are allowed to fish there. Children catch tadpoles, water snails and other tiny water creatures there. It is a lovely place to have a walk. There are many wild flowers such as clover, daisies, dandelions and bird's foot trefoil, otherwise known as Eggs and Bacon. There is white campbell and a few others too. On a hot day the pit is shady and on a windy day it is sheltered.
